text: states across the country have seen an
uptick in large protests in recent
months demonstrators have swarmed
airports and downtown streets protests
in the policy as a president Trump many
lawmakers especially Republicans have
expressed concern of the tactics and
they say stiffer punishments are
necessary to deter illegal behavior in
North Dakota for recently enacted laws
expand the criminal trespass statute
making it illegal to wear a mask or a
hood while committing a crime increase
the penalties for riot offenses and make
it easier for the state to bring in law
enforcement from elsewhere to help in
times of protest now in all these places
the lawmakers supporting these measures
so that protesting itself is fine
protected by the First Amendment and it
can be done in a legal orderly safe way
but they say that there's a line that's
been crossed the question in all of this
is what's the right balance between free
speech and public safety well the bills
may purport to advance public safety
these opponents say they actually may
give police too much leeway to quash
dissent in free speech but police on the
other hand say they faced an
unprecedented wave of demonstrations and
sometimes without permits and without
safe direction following and without
leaders and they need tougher
legislation to ensure an orderly process
and to ensure their own safety
